abstract: The European Central Bank extended its cash lifeline for banks on Thursday, while its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, urged national euro zone regulators to take steps to resuscitate confidence in the health of their financial institutions.
snippet: The European Central Bank extended its cash lifeline for banks on Thursday, while its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, urged national euro zone regulators to take steps to resuscitate confidence in the health of their financial institutions.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank extended its cash lifeline for banks on Thursday, while its president, Jean-Claude Trichet, urged national euro zone regulators to take steps to resuscitate confidence in the health of their financial institutions, Jack Ewing and Julia Werdigier write in The New York Times.

headline.main: E.C.B. Extends Cash Lifeline and Gives Pep Talk
